intro: Eroteum canescens, commonly known as the gray sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale purple or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered with a fine, grayish pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eroteum canescens is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
